classification_result.error_type: File location is not same as project's location
classification_result.error_message: Document indicates it is from Switzerland, but the expected project location is Germany.
classification_result.reasoning: The document is related to a Swiss Half Fare Card purchase, which qualifies as a travel expense. The presence of a monetary value, vendor information, and VAT details confirm it as an expense. Language is identified as English with high confidence. The document is related to Switzerland, as indicated by the Swiss Half Fare Card and currency (CHF), which does not match the expected location of Germany.

extraction_result.discount_details: Up to 50% discount on 1st and 2nd class tickets within one month. Only valid with your Passport / ID.

issues.description: The Supplier Name is missing. It is mandatory for 'Global People' ICP under all receipt types. Must be 'Global People DE GmbH'.
issues.recommendation: It is recommended to address this issue with the supplier or provider.
issues.knowledge_base_reference: FileRelatedRequirements: 'Supplier Name' must be 'Global People DE GmbH' for all receipt types under the 'Global People' ICP.

issues.description: The Supplier Address is missing. It is mandatory for 'Global People' ICP under all receipt types.
issues.recommendation: It is recommended to address this issue with the supplier or provider.
issues.knowledge_base_reference: FileRelatedRequirements: 'Supplier Address' must be 'Taunusanlage 8, 60329 Frankfurt, Germany' for all receipt types under the 'Global People' ICP.

issues.description: VAT Number is missing. It is mandatory under the 'Global People' ICP for all receipt types.
issues.recommendation: It is recommended to address this issue with the supplier or provider.
issues.knowledge_base_reference: FileRelatedRequirements: VAT number 'DE356366640' is mandatory for receipts under the 'Global People' ICP.

issues.description: The currency used in this receipt is CHF, which does not match the expected EURO currency for 'Global People' ICP.
issues.recommendation: It is recommended to use the local currency (EURO) to comply with country-specific regulations.
issues.knowledge_base_reference: FileRelatedRequirements: The currency must be consistent with local requirements for transactions.

issues.description: An A1 certificate is required for travel expenses under GoGlobal ICP when traveling. The extracted data lacks this certification.
issues.recommendation: Ensure to obtain an A1 certificate for compliance with travel documentation requirements.
issues.knowledge_base_reference: FileRelatedRequirements: Travel receipts under GoGlobal ICP require an A1 certificate present.

issues.description: The tax rate indicated (7.7%) is not applicable for travel receipts under the 'Global People' ICP.
issues.recommendation: Reevaluate the applicable tax rate for accuracy in financial reporting.
issues.knowledge_base_reference: FileRelatedRequirements: Tax implications must align with applicable standards; travel receipts generally follow specific ICP protocols.

issues.description: Employee name is missing. It is mandatory for documentation when exceeding certain financial thresholds for compliance reporting.
issues.recommendation: Ensure employee details are captured and documented appropriately.
issues.knowledge_base_reference: FileRelatedRequirements: Employee-specific documentation requirements must be fulfilled for receipts, especially when exceeding specific thresholds.

issues.description: Employee address is missing. It should be recorded for receipts requiring detailed employee information.
issues.recommendation: Ensure that employee addresses are included in receipt documentation for compliance purposes.
issues.knowledge_base_reference: FileRelatedRequirements: Address fields are mandatory components for certain expense types involving employee travel.

validation_result.compliance_summary: The receipt is not compliant due to several mandatory fields missing and mismatched financial details. Record and supplier information must be updated to align with 'Global People' ICP standards, ensuring the necessary documentation accompanies travel expense claims.
